You are riding your bike and your legs begin to feel shorter and shorter, your whole body is shrinking right before your eyes.

You find that your friend is also shrinking and the two of you will be experiencing this oddity together. You dart into a church on the corner where you are, looking for some Holy water. You think maybe the Holy water could reverse the shrinking. You find it and take a flask from the shelf in the rectory you fill the flask full of the water and you and your friend who also shrank tear out of the church so as not to get caught stealing from the church.

You don't know why this is happening, you haven't a clue what it could be. The two of you think that you need to find a cure for this curse.perhaps they would have to visit the old woman on the corner of the street where they live. she looked like she would have the answers. But would it shock her to see such tiny little people the fear they may scare her and she won't help them get back to normal.

The walls are almost vibrating with the force of the pumped up r&b music playing inside, and the laughing and shouting of young male voices adds to the racket. The door handle turns, and in the split second before it opens, your body shudders and stings all over as you shrink down to only inches tall. The door swings open and you look up to see your monolithic best friend, John, leaning on the doorframe and gazing around the yard, confused. His eyes eventually spot the brightly wrapped gift, which fell to the ground as you shrunk and is now a thousand times your size. As John eagerly bends to scoop the package up, his eyes sweep over you.. And his face lights up with glee. "Oh my GOD, dude! How did you know??" He beams down at you. You only stare back at him, confused now on so many levels. "How did you know I wanted a human pet for my birthday, man?? Ever since I lost Herman last week I've been fantasizing about having a tiny little guy to pick on, who can't do anything about it because I own his ass, and you really came through for me!! Oh, and what's this? ..A cage? Geez, man, you really thought of everything.." You shake your arms drastically, trying to ask for help, horrified at John's misinterpretation. But now it looks like you'll be eating all the humble pie at this birthday party, meanwhile giant John will be feeding his already overgrown hunger for power! "I'm not a pet." you say. "I don't know what happened but I brought the cage for Herman. I didn't know he had died."

John says, "Nah, I must have told you about Herman. I already had a cage for him."

"Not as good as this one. I got you one with all the hamster toys."

"I'm sure you'll have lots of fun playing with all of them."

You turn to the friends you like, "Mark, tell him I'm not a pet."

Mark looks like he's about to speak when one of the tough friends you don't like steps up next to Mark in an intimidating gesture. Mark stays silent.

At this point, you ponder why John is your best friend and remember that your parents are to blame. They do things to keep you isolated and John is one of the few friends they let you have. John's family has status. So you make the most of your limited social pool. At least John can be nice sometimes.

John sets the cage on the table next to his other gifts. On the other end of the table is the birthday cake. At least John is kind enough to give you a small piece of two-layer birthday cake that is slightly taller than you.
